video_description_en:
Stormy winds are blowing in the world and Finland is not immune. When the focus of citizens and residents is on the USA and Ukraine, it is important to ensure that â€œsmaller issues and decisionsâ€ are not hammered through in the shadow of the big ones.

Once a kindergarten or a school has been closed, a house has been demolished or the Baltic Sea has been filled in â€“ there are rarely any chances to reconsider the decisions. We need active decision-makers in Helsinki who have the strength to fight for their cause and for the good of the people of Helsinki.

Important issues for me:
â€¢ The cultural and historical heritage â€“ unique buildings should not be demolished ğŸ 
â€¢ Public transport â€“ sensible investments and affordable tickets ğŸšƒ
â€¢ Nature â€“ archipelago, forests and mountains close to the residents ğŸŒ¿
